content:
Selling online can be a great way to reach a wider audience.

You're absolutely right; considering you've put in work to restore the vanity, you should be able to sell it for at least $150. In fact, you might be able to sell it for more, depending on the demand and competition online.

Here are some additional tips to help you sell your restored vanity online:

1. **Choose the right platform**: Decide which online marketplace or platform to use, such as eBay, Etsy, Craigslist, or Facebook Marketplace. Each has its own fees, rules, and audience, so choose the one that best fits your needs.
2. **Use relevant keywords**: When writing your title and description, use keywords that potential buyers might use when searching for a similar item. This will help your listing show up in search results.
3. **Provide detailed measurements**: Make sure to include accurate measurements of the vanity, including the height, width, and depth. This will help buyers determine if it will fit in their space.
4. **Highlight the restoration work**: Emphasize the work you've done to restore the vanity, including any repairs, refinishing, or cleaning. This can help justify a higher price and attract buyers who are looking for a piece that's been well-cared for.
5. **Set a competitive price**: Research similar vanities online to determine a fair and competitive price. Keep in mind that you want to make a profit, but you also want to attract buyers.
6. **Be prepared to answer questions**: Be prepared to respond to potential buyers' questions and provide additional photos or information as needed.
7. **Consider offering free shipping**: If possible, consider offering free shipping to attract more buyers and make your listing more competitive.

By following these tips, you should be able to sell your restored vanity online for at least $150, and possibly more. Good luck!
